item.title: Andrea add a quote by Patrick Rothfuss
item.description: "It's like everyone tells a story about themselves inside their own head. Always. All the time. That story makes you what you are. We build ourselves out of that story." -- Patrick Rothfuss

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Orson Scott Card
item.description: "I think that most of us, anyway, read these stories that we know are not "true" because we're hungry for another kind of truth: the mythic truth about human nature in general, the particular truth about those life-communities that define our own identity, and the most specific truth of all: our own self-story. Fiction, because it is not about someone who lived in the real world, always has the possibility of being about oneself. --From the Introduction" -- Orson Scott Card

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Orson Scott Card
item.description: "Love is finding that the things you like best about yourself are not in you at all, but in the person who completes you" -- Orson Scott Card

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Orson Scott Card
item.description: "Because never in my entire childhood did I feel like a child. I felt like a person all along―the same person that I am today." -- Orson Scott Card

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Brandon Sanderson
item.description: "Belief isn't simply a thing for fair times and bright days...What is belief - what is faith - if you don't continue in it after failure?...Anyone can believe in someone, or something that always succeeds...But failure...ah, now, that is hard to believe in, certainly and truly. Difficult enough to have value. Sometimes we just have to wait long enough...then we find out why exactly it was that we kept believing...There's always another secret." -- Brandon Sanderson

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "I think... if it is true that there are as many minds as there are heads, then there are as many kinds of love as there are hearts." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Brandon Sanderson
item.description:
"You see, that is the sad, sorry, terrible thing about sarcasm.
It's really funny." -- Brandon Sanderson

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Brandon Sanderson
item.description: "Unknowing ignorance is preferable to informed stupidity." -- Brandon Sanderson

item.title: Andrea add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "There is nothing like looking, if you want to find something. You certainly usually find something, if you look, but it is not always quite the something you were after." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Andrea add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "His rage passes description - the sort of rage that is only seen when rich folk that have more than they can enjoy suddenly lose something that they have long had but have never before used or wanted." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Andrea add a quote by David Foster Wallace
item.description: "Fiction is one of the few experiences where loneliness can be both confronted and relieved. Drugs, movies where stuff blows up, loud parties -- all these chase away loneliness by making me forget my name's Dave and I live in a one-by-one box of bone no other party can penetrate or know. Fiction, poetry, music, really deep serious sex, and, in various ways, religion -- these are the places (for me) where loneliness is countenanced, stared down, transfigured, treated." -- David Foster Wallace

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Alan Paton
item.description: "But there is only one thing that has power completely, and this is love. Because when a man loves, he seeks no power, and therefore he has power." -- Alan Paton

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Thomas Lewis
item.description: "Long-standing togetherness writes permanent changes into a brain's open book. In a relationship, one mind revises another; one heart changes its partner. (144)" -- Thomas Lewis

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Thomas Lewis
item.description: "The first part of emotional healing is being limbically known - having someone with a keen ear catch your melodic essence. (170)" -- Thomas Lewis

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You know you're in love when you can't fall asleep because reality is finally better than your dreams." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Bram Stoker
item.description: "We learn from failure, not from success!" -- Bram Stoker

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Darkness cannot drive out darkness: only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate: only love can do that." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
item.description: "Goodbye," said the fox. "And now here is my secret, a very simple secret: It is only with the heart that one can see rightly; what is essential is invisible to the eye." -- Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Dale Carnegie
item.description: "The difference between appreciation and flattery? That is simple. One is sincere and the other insincere. One comes from the heart out; the other from the teeth out. One is unselfish; the other selfish. One is universally admired; the other universally condemned." -- Dale Carnegie

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Dale Carnegie
item.description: "You can't win an argument. You can't because if you lose it, you lose it; and if you win it, you lose it." -- Dale Carnegie

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Anne Morrow Lindbergh
item.description: "it takes as much courage to have tried and failed as it does to have tried and succeded." -- Anne Morrow Lindbergh
